seasonal: February is considered a slightly negative (bearish) month for the Euro. In the last 20 years, the Euro closed lower on March 1 compared to its price on February 20 in 65% of cases.

statistics.description: Around February 6, approximately 73% probability of a decline based on 20-year multi-seasonal statistics.
Around February 9, approximately 76% probability of a rise based on 20-year multi-seasonal statistics.
Around February 10, approximately 85% probability of a decline based on 20-year multi-seasonal statistics.
Anomalous cluster of daily turning point dates, suggesting high volatility in this period. Feb 3 and Feb 6 are the strongest dates within this cluster.
In 65% of the last 20 years, EUR/USD closed lower on March 1 compared to its price on February 20.

insights: February is a mildly bearish month for EUR/USD from a seasonal perspective.
There is a one-day weekly cycle centered on the week ending around February 20 - be prepared for a turning point around that time window.
The daily cycle dates between February 1-11 show an unusual concentration of turning points, implying high volatility in early February.
The February 17 turning point aligns with the weekly cycle, making it a potentially important trend-change signal.
When a clear technical level coincides with a turning point date, it offers a better risk/reward trade setup with improved risk-to-reward ratio.
At the current stage, only if the Euro returns below the retracement level and holds below it, would it make sense to consider short trades around the turning point date windows.
In December, EUR/USD showed a classic rally with rising highs and lows - this is how a healthy uptrend should appear.
For the Euro to confirm a sustained uptrend (not just a short-term move within a range), it must halt the correction that started at end of January.
The weekly candle that closed the recent move was a 'falling star' (shooting star) type, meaning sellers exploited the highs to exit the Euro.
A clean and backed breakout above 1.1920 is needed to talk about a clear return to an upward trend, opening the path to the next resistance zone around 1.2230.
Ongoing updates on EUR/USD price action will be published in the Discord community and during weekly live sessions.

support.description: Current support zone combining Fibonacci retracement levels. This is the decision zone on the daily chart. Acts as a possible retracement base.
First key support from below on the weekly chart.
Weekly low from around early August area. Overlaps with the 61.8% Fibonacci retracement of the rally that started in May, making it a significant test level for continuation.
Defined as the decision zone. A break below signals a character change in the trend and potentially the start of a new primary downtrend.
Daily support level, though no longer playing a central role at this stage and therefore less relevant for current decisions.

resistance.description: Weekly resistance level that was briefly broken in late January. A clean breakout above this level is required to confirm return to uptrend.
Next resistance zone above 1.1920. Once 1.1920 is cleared, this becomes the next upside target area.
Upper resistance zone visible on the weekly chart.
Intermediate resistance zone on the weekly chart.

technical.indicators: Fibonacci retracement levels are central to the analysis. Key Fibonacci levels on the daily chart: 0.382 (1.18907), 0.5 (1.18313), 0.618 (1.17719), 0.786 (1.16877), 1.0 (1.15796). The 61.8% Fibonacci retracement of the May-onward rally sits near 1.1390. Weekly chart shows a 'shooting star' candle pattern suggesting sellers are active at the highs. The daily chart zone of 1.1772-1.1814 is the critical decision area: if price holds there and stabilizes, it supports trend continuation upward; if it breaks, it changes the character of the move and increases the probability of a deeper correction.

summary: EUR/USD faces a mildly bearish February from a seasonal standpoint, with a 65% historical tendency to decline from mid-to-late February into March. The critical decision zone sits at 1.1772-1.1814 on the daily chart: holding above supports the bullish case while a break below shifts the outlook toward deeper correction. Traders should watch the dense cluster of turning point dates in early February (especially Feb 3 and Feb 6) and the weekly-cycle-aligned Feb 17 date for potential trend-change signals.
risk_notes: All turning point dates may deviate by +/- 1 day from the stated date.
The report is for educational purposes only and does not constitute investment advice, a recommendation, or a solicitation to execute trades.
The content should not replace the judgment of a qualified investment advisor who considers the unique needs of each individual investor.
The weekly chart breakout at 1.1920 showed signs of being a failed breakout (shooting star candle with sellers exploiting highs), so caution is warranted on the bullish side.
A break below the 1.1190-1.1275 support zone would signal a clear change in trend character and potentially the start of a new primary downtrend.
High volatility is expected in the Feb 1-11 period due to the unusual cluster of daily turning point dates.

turning_points.result: Did not work. Neither date managed to halt the declining move.
Worked. Served as the low of the declining move, and a significant rally began from this point until the next turning date.
Partially worked on that day only, but was subsequently broken to the upside.
Worked. Served as the high of the upward move.
